bio.summary: Still waters run deep ...this expression pretty much applies here as well. Hidden from public exposure, the name David May might put question marks on the faces of those who do not know. Mainly working behind the scenes, multi-instrumentalist David built a long list of achievements as a writer, composer and producer. As a graduate in classical music and sound engineering, he is responsible for many hit productions and a part of internationally successful projects, which people from all different genres should be aware of. Read more on Last.fm
bio.content: Still waters run deep ...this expression pretty much applies here as well. Hidden from public exposure, the name David May might put question marks on the faces of those who do not know. Mainly working behind the scenes, multi-instrumentalist David built a long list of achievements as a writer, composer and producer. As a graduate in classical music and sound engineering, he is responsible for many hit productions and a part of internationally successful projects, which people from all different genres should be aware of..... His creativeness and versatility is reflected in the various styles ranging from House, Pop, R'n'B to Trance, of which Dave is capable of producing. Besides the House and Trance tracks mainly created under his guise David Prodygee at his own Panevino Village studio, he was also responsible producing for internationally successful acts such as the late Laura Brannigan, Katrina & The Waves, Taylor Dayne and the Dutch Band R.O.O.O.M. with whom he had a respectable success in the Charts David's debut Solo single, which he produced in co-operation with SVEN GREINER has the meaningful title "Superstar". The idea of this track came from a string sequence originally recorded for an orchestral version of the Rolling Stones' classic "The Last Time". 90's Indie band "The Verve" had a massive hit taking the string sample using it for their own single "Bitter Sweet Symphony". Dave and Sven have now replayed this world famous melody sequence and created a new track of its own merit, featuring ear catching vocals from MOISES MODESTO and DUANE HARDEN and squeezing them into a driving electro beat. Their new interpretation was given a full clearance from Rolling Stones' publisher ABKCO, who approved this title for release through DJ SHOGs "7th Sense Records" label. "Superstar" has a huge potential, ensuring it is bound to crossover in tomorrow's market and will instantly introduce David May not only as a producer, but also as a much wanted House and Electro DJ worldwide The year 2010 further brought out the follow-up single I'LL BE WATCHING YOU (feat. KELVIN SCOTT) which is a cover version of the Police recording „Every Breath You Take“ currently being signed to various territories yet to be released. After this production, David decided to take a break from the public scene to concentrate on other projects he was producing and to figure out what to come out with as the third single. So far, David has sold over 600'000 records of originals, projects and remixes he produced and his productions are included on CDs sold already over 5 Million copies including German and British major compilations. David is also a much favorited artist to be searched for on YouTube with already over 5 Mio clicks in total. Read more on Last.fm.
